definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: If one flute goes out of tune – you’d know all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有一支長笛走掉了，你就會聽的一清二楚。

sentences.english: Waggle their tails and off they go.
He'd buggered off before I had a chance to get a word in.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒有來得及跟他說一句話他就走掉了。

sentences.english: They walked off and left me sitting there all by myself .
sentences.chinese: 他們走掉了，讓我孤零一個人坐在那裏。

sentences.english: He sidled away from me while I was talking to the postman.
sentences.chinese: 我同郵遞員講話時，他偷偷走掉了。

sentences.english: It was stupid of me to leave the car unlocked.
sentences.chinese: 我沒把車所上就走掉，實在太笨了。

sentences.english: East strains that much wisdom passing see a love dearly, but neglects to walk away.
sentences.chinese: 東株路過見到那樣的多智一陣心疼，卻忽視着走掉了。

sentences.english: There was no time. He was too impatient to be gone.
sentences.chinese: 沒有時間了，他太急於走掉。

sentences.english: Three tumbrilsfaring away with their dread loads over the hushing snow.
sentences.chinese: 三部死囚車載着可怕的貨物在寂寂的雪地上走掉了。

sentences.english: She didn't humph and went away.
sentences.chinese: 她連哼都沒哼一聲就走掉了。

sentences.english: The second tumbril empties and moves on; the third comes up. Crash!
sentences.chinese: 第二輛囚車下完了人走掉了，第三輛開了上來。

sentences.english: If you find it, don't let it go.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你找到它，就不要讓它走掉。

sentences.english: After two of the men on the bench left, the others eased up.
sentences.chinese: 走掉兩個人以後，長凳上的另外幾個人坐得寬舒了。

sentences.english: He did not feel, and I arrive ated his nearby, also can walk off of.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有感覺到，我來到了他的身邊，也會走掉的。

sentences.english: Then I picked up the little girl and walked off.
sentences.chinese: 然後我把小女孩抱起走掉。

sentences.english: Before I could say anything, she had moved on.
sentences.chinese: 而在我開口準備說點什麼之前，她已經走掉了。

definition: to run away/to take to one's heels
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
dull gray/gloomy/dejected/crestfallen/with one's tail between one's legs
to leave in stealth/to slip away
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to swagger off/to walk off (or drive off etc) without a second thought for those left behind
